abstract: Defense Sec Ashton B Carter proposes allowing highly skilled civilians to make lateral move into military and become senior uniformed officers as part of initiative to change how United States military recruits and retains those with high levels of expertise; officials express doubt over whether proposal can be put into effect before Pres Obama leaves office and Carter is likely replaced.
lead_paragraph: The proposals would require congressional approval, and officials on Capitol Hill doubted whether legislation could be passed before President Obama’s term ends.

headline.main: Defense Secretary Seeks to Find and Keep Those With Key Expertise
headline.print_headline: Defense Secretary Promotes Ways to Find and Keep Those With Key Skills

snippet: The proposals would require congressional approval, and officials on Capitol Hill doubted whether legislation could be passed before President Obama’s term ends.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
